intro: Scorzonera aksarayensis, commonly known as Aksaray scorzonera, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots, which are often used in traditional medicine. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves and produces yellow or orange composite flowers. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
